Medicine_tweet_34_r.News Finding: "Chronic inflammation is a driving force for the development of metabolic disease including "diabetes and "obesity" + "The rational modulation of T-cell senescence would be a promising avenue for the treatment or prevention of diabetes"
Medicine_tweet_34_r.Paper Finding: These suggest that T-cell senescence-mediated reprogramming of metabolic pathways may be associated with development of diabetes and its complications, as well as other aging-related diseases.
Medicine_tweet_34_r.News Context: "Chronic inflammation is a driving force for the development of metabolic disease including "diabetes and "obesity" + "The rational modulation of T-cell senescence would be a promising avenue for the treatment or prevention of diabetes"
Medicine_tweet_34_r.Paper Context: In addition, we demonstrated that these CD8 + CD28 − T cells reside within the liver and are more numerous in the liver of aged and HFD-fed mice. These suggest that T-cell senescence-mediated reprogramming of metabolic pathways may be associated with development of diabetes and its complications, as well as other aging-related diseases. • In conclusion, we identified a link between the numbers and secretion of effector molecules by senescent T cells, and blood glucose status, in humans and mice.

Medicine_tweet_213_r.News Finding: Yes. Food ads do make you fatter.  #diet #nutrition #food
Medicine_tweet_213_r.Paper Finding: The overweight and obese sample here reported a stronger desire to eat following priming with a series of television advertisements for food products than when primed with advertisements for non-food products.
Medicine_tweet_213_r.News Context: Yes. Food ads do make you fatter.  #diet #nutrition #food
Medicine_tweet_213_r.Paper Context: In contrast to Experiment 1, exposure to television food advertising also affected ratings of desire to eat. The overweight and obese sample here reported a stronger desire to eat following priming with a series of television advertisements for food products than when primed with advertisements for non-food products. This suggests that in overweight and obese individuals, exposure to food commercials not only activates food-related cognitions, but also triggers a motivation to eat.
Medicine_tweet_213_r.text: ['Finding: Yes. Food ads do make you fatter. #diet #nutrition #food']
Medicine_tweet_213_r.displayed_text: Finding: Yes. Food ads do make you fatter. #diet #nutrition #food

Medicine_50_r.News Finding: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.
Medicine_50_r.Paper Finding: One factor that merits additional attention is the association between a youth's history of experiencing corporal punishment and perpetration of dating violence.
Medicine_50_r.News Context: About 19 percent said they had committed some form of dating violence and 69 percent said they were physically punished during childhood. The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood. Specifically, people who got spanked as kids had a 29 percent higher risk for perpetrating dating violence, the findings showed.
Medicine_50_r.Paper Context: 9 These factors cut across various domains including affective (eg, emotion dysregulation, psychiatric disorder), cognitive (eg, attitudes toward women, beliefs about violence), demographic (eg, age, race, sex, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status), interpersonal (eg, relationship satisfaction, problem solving skills), contextual (eg, availability of weapon, drug/alcohol use), as well as distal factors (eg, history of child abuse, exposure to family violence). One factor that merits additional attention is the association between a youth's history of experiencing corporal punishment and perpetration of dating violence. Attaining a better understanding of antecedents of dating violence is critical for preventive strategies seeking to mitigate dating violence among youth.
Medicine_50_r.text: ['Finding: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.']
Medicine_50_r.displayed_text: Finding: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.

Medicine_tweet_163_r.News Finding: Do women with sexual arousal disorders just need a little more giddyap in their heartbeat?
Medicine_tweet_163_r.Paper Finding: In conclusion, low HRV may be a risk factor for female sexual arousal dysfunction and overall sexual dysfunction.
Medicine_tweet_163_r.News Context: Do women with sexual arousal disorders just need a little more giddyap in their heartbeat?
Medicine_tweet_163_r.Paper Context: Women with below average HRV were significantly more likely to report sexual arousal dysfunction (p \ .001) and overall sexual dysfunction (p \ .001) than both women with average HRV and women with above average HRV. In conclusion, low HRV may be a risk factor for female sexual arousal dysfunction and overall sexual dysfunction. Given these findings, it is reasonable to expect ANS activity (indexed by HRV) may be related to women's self-reported, real-life sexual arousal function outside of the laboratory.
Medicine_tweet_163_r.text: ['Finding: Do women with sexual arousal disorders just need a little more giddyap in their heartbeat? ']
Medicine_tweet_163_r.displayed_text: Finding: Do women with sexual arousal disorders just need a little more giddyap in their heartbeat?

Medicine_tweet_38_r.News Finding: The #behaviour of overweight #dogs shows similarity with #personality traits of overweight humans [BIOLOGY (WHOLE ORGANISM)]  BLet @username
Medicine_tweet_38_r.Paper Finding: These results are very similar to those expected from the parallel models that exist between certain personality traits and being overweight in humans, suggesting that dogs are indeed a promising model for experimentally investigating obesity in humans.
Medicine_tweet_38_r.News Context: The #behaviour of overweight #dogs shows similarity with #personality traits of overweight humans [BIOLOGY (WHOLE ORGANISM)]  BLet @username
Medicine_tweet_38_r.Paper Context: Our results also confirm that overweight dogs, as opposed to normal weight dogs, tried to maximize food intake from the higher quality food and hesitated to do the task when the food reward was uncertain. These results are very similar to those expected from the parallel models that exist between certain personality traits and being overweight in humans, suggesting that dogs are indeed a promising model for experimentally investigating obesity in humans. Dogs, due to their shared living environment with humans, may provide a beneficial model to study the causes and consequences of obesity.

Medicine_tweet_3_r.News Finding: Study:Parental Support May Protect Young African American Women Against #Obesity #journalofdiabetesmetabolicdisorders
Medicine_tweet_3_r.Paper Finding: Conclusion: High maternal support appears to be protective against increases in BMI among African American female young adults.
Medicine_tweet_3_r.News Context: Study:Parental Support May Protect Young African American Women Against #Obesity #journalofdiabetesmetabolicdisorders
Medicine_tweet_3_r.Paper Context: We could not find such an association for male African American young adults. Conclusion: High maternal support appears to be protective against increases in BMI among African American female young adults. As parental support is a modifiable factor within available evidence-based interventions that enhance parenting, it should be included in obesity prevention programs for African American women.
Medicine_tweet_3_r.text: ['Finding: Study:Parental Support May Protect Young African American Women Against #Obesity #journalofdiabetesmetabolicdisorders ']
